entry.title: Orbx Releases Coleman A. Young International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Orbx has recently released their rendition of Coleman A. Young International Airport (KDET) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving Detroit, Michigan, with a yearly average of 32,850 passengers. It opened as Detroit City Airport Terminal in 1927, designed by architect Perry A. Fellows and built by W. E. Wood Co., after five years of searching for an adequate location and carrying on the necessary construction work. Two years later, the administration built the first hangar, and it quickly rose into Detroit‚Äôs main airport at the time. It was Detroit‚Äôs main airport until 1947, when Wayne County Metropolitan Airport took over the majority of the flights. That happened in large part because Detroit City Airport couldn‚Äôt be expanded further due to a cemetery in the vicinity, which local residents did not agree to demolishing. Traffic kept on dying over the years, with airline service completely ending in 2000 and the airport‚Äôs focus shifting over to pilot training and handling private/corporate flights. The FAA has recently approved a plan to improve the airport‚Äôs infrastructure - the first in 30 years - which should theoretically unlock more than 100 million USD in federal funds over the next decade, allowing the administration to work on a new control tower, improved taxiways, and a regulation-compliant safety zone. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with hand-crafted custom assets, custom ground textures, PBR texturing, fully modeled interiors, custom night lighting, and much more. It‚Äôs available on OrbxDirect for roughly $13.83, requiring at least 2.77 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Paulo Ricardo Releases Recife International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Paulo Ricardo has recently released their rendition of Recife/Guararapes‚ÄîGilberto Freyre International Airport (SBRF) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil, with an average of 9 million passengers per year. It was built during World War 2 to replace an airfield at the same location. In the years following the conflict, it became a strategic technical and refueling stop on routes from South America to Europe. A new passenger terminal was inaugurated in 1958, and its two runways were extended at the time to accommodate larger aircraft. In the late 1970s, an agreement was reached with Infraero (a state-owned airport operator) to further develop the airport, leading to renovations in 1982 and expansion work in the 1990s. A new passenger terminal, including a shopping mall and a concourse, was built in 2004, increasing its passenger handling capacity from 1.5 million a year to 9 million. In late 2009, the government invested 8 million BRL into upgrading the terminal for the 2014 World Cup, adding eight more jetways and modernizing the infrastructure. It‚Äôs a hub for Azul Linhas A√©reas and is served by Gol Linhas A√©reas, LATAM Brasil, TAP Air Portugal, and Voepass Linhas A√©reas. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, a highly detailed passenger terminal with a partially modeled interior, city landmarks, an up-to-date ground layout, and much more. ‚Äã It‚Äôs available in the Marketplace (2020 and 2024) for $11.99. entry.title: Kiss Simulation Releases Sarajevo International Airport for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Kiss Simulation has recently released their updated rendition of Sarajevo International Airport (LQSA) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, serving the city of Sarajevo in Bosnia and Herzegovina, and averaging 1.3 million passengers a year. It was built in 1966 and opened for traffic three years later, although domestically. International operations began a year later, with Frankfurt as its first international destination. The first renovation happened nearly 20 years later for the 1984 Winter Olympics, with a new terminal building, a runway extension, and navigational system improvements. The terminal was expanded in 2017, with a new 10,000-square-meter building capable of handling up to 2 million passengers a year. Its mountainous terrain and unpredictable weather have led to multiple financial losses over the years, most notably in December 2015, when over 40% of flights were canceled. The only way they could fix it would be by moving the threshold an additional 200 meters, which would shorten the runway, which is not ideal given that it‚Äôs already relatively short at 2,600 meters. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, including the new terminal extension, a custom runway profile, a real-world ILS profile, custom-made ground textures, an up-to-date ground layout, runway weathering, and more. It‚Äôs available on SimMarket for $15.50, requiring at least 1.75 GB of free hard disk space. Owners of the 2020 version are entitled to a free upgrade. entry.title: Fly 2 High Releases Tweed New Haven for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fly 2 High has recently released their rendition of Tweed-New Haven Regional Airport (KHVN) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving New Haven and the New York Metropolitan Area, with an average of 1.1 million passengers per year. The airport opened for traffic in late 1931 as New Haven Municipal Airport. Li-Con Airways Incorporated and American Airlines were the first to commercially serve the then brand-new airport in 1933 and 1934, respectively. While Li-Con‚Äôs service lasted only a year, American Airlines‚Äô route between Boston, New Haven, and New York lasted nearly three decades. Allegheny Airlines and Allegheny Commuter took over after American Airlines ended regularly scheduled service, operating BAC One-Eleven jets until the mid-1970s. In the late 1970s, New Haven Airways kicked off their scheduled flights, becoming New Haven‚Äôs hometown airline - NewAir -, operating flights to New York (JFK and La Guardia), Philadelphia, Baltimore/Washington Intl, and Washington National with their fleet of de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter, Embraer EMB-110 Bandeirante, and Short 360s. NewAir‚Äôs operations were relatively short-lived, with operations ending in 1985. After the mid-1980s, regularly scheduled service started declining massively, with airlines starting and quickly ending operations in New Haven. It wasn‚Äôt until the 2010s that New Haven would see renewed activity. In late 2024, the airport received $ 4 million to build a new passenger terminal, aiming to replace the previous one, built nearly a century ago, with modern facilities, almost 8,000 square meters of area, and greatly improving the airport‚Äôs passenger handling capabilities. There are also plans to expand the runway. Avelo Airlines and Breeze Airways are the only two airlines currently serving the airport. The scenery promises an accurate rendition of the airport, with an up-to-date ground layout, custom terminal and airport buildings, high-resolution PBR ground textures, a detailed apron, realistic night lighting, and performance-friendly optimization. It‚Äôs available in the iniBuilds Store for roughly $9.64, requiring at least 3.36 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Fly 2 High Releases Birmingham-Shuttlesworth International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fly 2 High has recently released their rendition of Birmingham-Shuttlesworth International Airport (KBHM) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving Birmingham, Alabama, with an average of 3.2 million passengers per year, making it the largest and busiest airport in the state. The airport opened in early 1931 with a single east-west runway and a two-story passenger terminal. The airport was leased to the United States Army Air Forces for $1 a year during World War 2 to support national defense, becoming Birmingham Army Airfield. The period under the US Army‚Äôs helm brought several improvements, such as new paved taxiways, a new control tower, and the construction of an aircraft modification center. Despite Birmingham being considered a potential air transportation hub for the American South, an aviation fuel tax imposed by the city made it financially unfeasible for many operators, leading Atlanta to become the preferred choice instead. ‚Äã The airport played an important role during the Bay of Pigs invasion in 1961, with pilots and crew from the Alabama National Air Guard selected to train Cuban exile fliers in Nicaragua to fly the Douglas B-26 Invader. ‚Äã A second passenger terminal was built in 1962 to accommodate the ever-growing passenger figures, along with a new control tower. ‚Äã Then, a new semi-circular terminal was completed in 1973 with 15 aircraft gates and a large parking deck. ‚Äã Between 1970 and 1992, a slow demolition process began to completely demolish the original passenger terminal built in 1931. The 1990s brought multiple runway expansions to accommodate larger aircraft. ‚Äã In 2011, the administration approved a new three-phase terminal modernization project, demolishing the old terminal from 1962, the semi-circular terminal from 1973, and constructing new facilities with 19 gates, doubling the airport‚Äôs footprint. It‚Äôs served by American Airlines, American Eagle, Delta Air Lines, Delta Connection, Southwest Airlines, United Airlines, and United Express. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, an up-to-date ground layout, custom jetways, accurate taxiways, custom PBR texturing, performance-friendly optimization, custom night lighting, and much more. ‚Äã It‚Äôs available on OrbxDirect (2020 version here) for roughly $16.10, requiring at least 3.04 GB of free hard disk space. entry.title: iniBuilds Releases Dallas Fort Worth International Airport for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has just released its version of Dallas Fort Worth International Airport (KDFW) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. This airport serves the Dallas‚ÄìFort Worth‚ÄìArlington metropolitan area and was the world‚Äôs fourth-busiest airport by passenger traffic last year, welcoming an impressive 85.6 million passengers. The airport began commercial operations in 1974 under the name Dallas/Fort Worth Regional Airport. It was renamed Dallas/Fort Worth International in 1985. Initially, the airport had just four terminals, but it has since expanded to five, with plans for a sixth terminal underway. With seven runways, the airport accommodates nearly 90 million passengers each year. It serves a variety of airlines and is a hub for American Airlines, Ameriflight, Southern Airways Express, and UPS Airlines, while also serving as a base of operations for Frontier Airlines and Spirit Airlines. These airlines, along with many others, offer destinations worldwide. iniBuilds has included a comprehensive set of features in the scenery package. The airport layout is up-to-date, and it includes high-definition jetways and dynamic airport lighting. entry.title: X-Codr Designs Announces Airport Enhancement Package 2.0 for X-Plane
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. X-Codr has recently announced a substantial update to their Airport Enhancement Package add-on for X-Plane, bringing procedurally generated life to over 36,000 airports around the globe. While the original AEP focused on replacing key assets (ground textures, common buildings, and service vehicles), AEP 2.0 aims to add to airports, not just replace assets around them. After months of development and tinkering, the developer has managed to create a program that reads and understands the global airports, procedurally generating overlays that greatly enhance the experience with tire skids on taxi routes, runways, and service roads, additional clutter at gates and near buildings, grunge, oil leaks, rust, and random ramp clutter, yielding a more lifelike experience around every airport in the simulator. While the procedural generation is the new star of the show, it doesn‚Äôt mean AEP no longer replaces assets, with over a thousand custom assets in total, including new pavement textures, service vehicles, new cars, all of the legacy hangars (and new ones), and various clutter objects. There are a couple of things that are still being worked on before release, such as more baggage cart variants, old long metal hangars, cargo area clutter, stability testing for a new feature yet to be announced, and beta testing. They also use this opportunity to seek people willing to help stress-test the new product and aid in shaping the final release through their contact page or Discord. Furthermore, the developer has also mentioned that it will be a free upgrade for AEP 1.0 owners. If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! ‚Äç
